embed: <object width="425" height="344"><param name="movie" value="http://www.youtube.com/v/KUOoStyV7Zs&hl=en&fs=1"><param name="allowFullScreen" value="true"><param name="allowscriptaccess" value="always"><embed src="http://www.youtube.com/v/KUOoStyV7Zs&hl=en&fs=1" allowscriptaccess="always" height="344" width="425" allowfullscreen="true" type="application/x-shockwave-flash"></embed></object>
summary:
A poster session for a hands-on demo of "BitbeamBot". It started as an art
project, but it has a much more serious practical application: mobile web
testing. To trust that your mobile app truly works, you need an end-to-end
test on the actual device. BitbeamBot is an Arduino-powered open-source
hardware CNC robot that can test any application on any mobile device.
title: 37. Building a Robot that Can Play Angry Birds on a Smartphone (or Robots are the Future of Testing)
